balanoglossus.name: Balanoglossus
balanoglossus.description:
Balanoglossus is a marine, worm-like animal.
It lives buried in sand or mud.
It shows features linking invertebrates and chordates.
introduction: Balanoglossus is a free-living marine hemichordate.
It inhabits sandy and muddy sea shores.
It is important in understanding chordate evolution.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Gill slits and diffusion
Circulatory type: Present, open circulation, single
Excretory organ: Proboscis gland with glomerulus
Nervous system: Diffuse nerve net with dorsal nerve cord
Metamerism: Absent (body divided into proboscis, collar, trunk)
sizeStructure: Body divided into proboscis, collar, and trunk
Numerous gill slits in trunk region
ecology: Helps nutrient recycling in coastal areas

saccoglossus.name: Saccoglossus
saccoglossus.description:
Saccoglossus is a small marine acorn worm.
It lives in U-shaped burrows.
It shows basic chordate-like features.
introduction: It inhabits sandy and muddy coastal regions.
It is important in evolutionary studies.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Gill slits and diffusion
Circulatory type: Present, open circulation, single
Excretory organ: Proboscis gland with glomerulus
Nervous system: Diffuse nerve net with dorsal nerve cord

ptychodera-flava.name: Ptychodera flava
ptychodera-flava.description:
Ptychodera flava is a large acorn worm.
It lives buried in marine sediments.
It clearly shows hemichordate characters.
introduction: Ptychodera flava is a free-living marine animal.
It inhabits shallow sandy and muddy shores.
It is important for studying chordate ancestry.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Gill slits and diffusion
Circulatory type: Present, open circulation, single
Excretory organ: Proboscis gland with glomerulus
Nervous system: Diffuse nerve net with dorsal nerve cord
ecology: Part of coastal benthic food web
economy: Helps understand origin of chordate traits
